channel.title: Possible Worlds on
channel.description: Recent content in Possible Worlds on

item.title: Science
item.description: It is our strong belief that the AI of the future will be based on science, rather than ad-hoc methods. We strive to elucidate and complement the most precious aspects of human cognition: the ability to explain, understand and imagine. Our strategy is to combine cutting-edge research in cognitive science and computational modelling to develop new types of algorithms. To learn about the science underpinning our technology, check out Denotation IO.

item.title: Possible Worlds: our company
item.description: We believe that a company should not only provide solutions; it should also ask questions. Here are some fundamental questions we have about our trade (Artificial Intelligence), about the kind of organisation we want to be, and ultimately about our planet. We have been thinking about them for a long time, so we link to past and current projects of ours (✍). Rethinking the world Possible Worlds does what it says on the tin: our organization is concerned about envisaging alternatives to the status quo.

item.title: Team
item.description: Nina Rismal Nina is an economist and political philosopher interested in social change. LinkedIn Aurelie Herbelot Aurelie is a computational linguist with strong links to the cognitive science community. LinkedIn | Website

item.title: About
item.description: We research, create and interpret possible worlds - nonexistent and not yet existent ones - utilising AI and insights from social sciences, humanities and the arts. A ‘possible world’ is a technical term in linguistics describing a complete and consistent way the world is or could have been. We are a research-driven company, supported by our sister company, Possible Worlds Research.

item.title: Contact
item.description: For any enquiry about Possible Worlds, please contact us at: user="contact",domain="possible-worlds.xyz",document.write(user+"@"+domain);contact at possible-worlds.xyz
